intro: Alsine acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered alsike, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its flowers are small and pinkish-white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Alsine acutiflora is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
